@CaoimheNicD @Cooplafocal @IrishAesthete @davidhicksbook @IrishGeorgian @felixmlarkin Also JER didnâ€™t spend a huge amount of time there. We was between Leeson Park Dublin & Wynnstay Gardens London mostly. However, he really loved Aughavannagh & tried to go as often as political schedules permitted. John Dillon once corresponded with him on what lawnmower to get.

@CaoimheNicD @Cooplafocal @IrishAesthete @davidhicksbook @IrishGeorgian My Granny lived there in the â€˜30s. Said it was cold and isolated but she got great stories out of it. Iâ€™ll need to check my notes but Louis G Redmond Howard (of the GPB) lived there after JER. Not entirely clear on how it passed from CSP to JER. @felixmlarkin any info?

@HMcEntee @LaceyDermot @rtenews Thatâ€™s awful, Iâ€™d say you were raging. Watching at home we just assumed @simoncoveney was suffering from a bad dose of mansplaining. I hope you told them all itâ€™s youâ€™re getting the mic next time. It sent out a really bad message, especially to young people.

@LaceyDermot @rtenews Nah, it wasnâ€™t any doughnut effect. She was stood right beside him as if she was about to be interviewed and then she was never asked a question or anything. Disappointing and really awkward to watch.

Did anyone else just see that mad interview on @rtenews where Helen McEntee stood silently beside Simon Coveney during a 5mins plus interview?? Is this the message weâ€™re sending out: that women should be seen and not heard in Irish Politics?
